name: propulsive
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
moving to the next part, situation, etc. very quickly, often in an exciting way : Their music features propulsive rhythms that you just have to dance to. Cinematic blockbusters are often propulsive and full of thrills.
physics
  specialized pushing or moving something somewhere, often with a lot of force : When you sail a boat, you are transforming winds into propulsive power. Their new engine offers the greatest propulsive efficiency of any commercial transport.
More examplesFewer examplesThere's a lot to admire in this propulsive action thriller.The failure of consumers to understand the effects of their purchasing decisions provides a propulsive push for unsustainable development.
